description.value:
Wild berserkers, the cursed, and people with serious anger issues. Barbarians fight recklessly, throwing themselves into a mighty rage which allows them to shrug off grievous wounds.

The following is a revision of the 5e barbarian class, meant to add quality of life features and revitalize or replace abilities that weren't useful. The class now also has some choice when it comes to mid and high level abilities. Existing 5e subclasses will all work mechanically with this form of the barbarian class. Click @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.VLxJ80DY7q7hkXU7.JournalEntryPage.QjLATbZ1uI3tAwjs#barbarian]{here} for a summary of changes.

Level 1 Barbarians

When you create a level 1 Barbarian, you will need to manually add your ability scores. You will gain the rest of the following automatically:

Recommended Ability Scores

You can take one of these recommended ability score arrays, or you can roll or assign them yourself. You can switch any two ability scores, but you do not add any further bonuses (they're already included).

&reference[Strength]: 16 &reference[Dexterity]:14 &reference[Constitution]: 14 &reference[Intelligence]: 8 &reference[Wisdom]: 12 &reference[Charisma]: 12

or

Strength: 16 Dexterity:13 Constitution: 16 Intelligence: 8 Wisdom: 10 Charisma: 12

Feat

You gain a level 1 @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.lGAvinVvDjAXzQ1Q]{feat} of your choice. You can choose from the feats available to all classes or choose a level 1 class-specific feat, if there is one available.

Hit Points

Hit Points at 1st Level: 12 + Constitution Modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d12 (or 7) + Constitution Modifier
Hit Dice: 1d12 per barbarian level

Proficiencies

@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1]{Armor}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.4ZoOlPhNDk46Vvnr]{Light Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.pHlopVD36uBfquJF]{Medium Armor}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp]{Weapons}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS]{Simple Weapons}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.MzJ8wA3QJOZDJ1El]{Martial Weapons}
Saving Throws: &Reference[Strength], &Reference[Constitution]
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.rv19GFzEa0nMTuAF]{Skills}: two of: &Reference[Animal Handling], &Reference[Athletics], &Reference[Intimidation], &Reference[Nature], &Reference[Perception], and &Reference[Survival]

Items

You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

  • a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.YVEcMNtAEQnGLv0S]{greataxe} -OR- any @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.MzJ8wA3QJOZDJ1El#martial-melee-weapons]{martial melee weapon}
  • two @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.rIzJTl2bsFVDNji3]{handaxes} -OR- any @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS]{simple weapon}
  • five @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.pM8eu7VlKCHmEi3N]{javelins}
  • @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.O8vBudyTBZs03cTF]{hide armor}
  • An explorer's pack

Multiclass Characters

Instead of leveling up in your original class, you can take a barbarian level when you level up. When you do, you gain only a portion of what first level barbarians gain.

Multiclassing Ability Score Requirements

Taking levels in several classes requires exceptional ability. You must meet the multiclassing ability score requirements for both your original class and the class you are multiclassing into.

For barbarians you must have:

  • EitherStrength: 14 orDexterity: 14

  • Consitution: 14

Hit Points

Per Level: 1d12 (or 7) + Constitution Modifier
Hit Dice: 1d12 per barbarian level

Proficiencies

@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1]{Armor}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.4ZoOlPhNDk46Vvnr]{Light Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.pHlopVD36uBfquJF]{Medium Armor}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp]{Weapons}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS]{Simple Weapons}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.MzJ8wA3QJOZDJ1El]{Martial Weapons}

advancement.title: Fighting Style
advancement.hint: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options from the appropriate class list. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

advancement.title: Stubborn Will
advancement.hint: You gain proficiency in wisdom saving throws.

advancement.title: Superior Ability
advancement.hint: You increase one ability score of your choice by 2, to a maximum of 22.

advancement.title: Feat
advancement.hint:
At this level and every level you gain an ability score improvement, you also gain a feat of your choice. You are eligible for general feats, monk feats, and combat maneuver feats by default.
                                                        You may be eligible for other feats, which you can drag from the appropriate compendium into this box below.
                                                        
                                                        Some feats have additional prerequisites. Check the description of a feat before choosing it.

advancement.title: Feat
advancement.hint: You gain a level 1 feat of your choice. You can choose from the feats available to all classes or choose a level 1 class-specific feat, if there is one available.

advancement.title: Primal Path
advancement.hint:
Choose a Primal Path. This represents where your rage comes from and how it manifests. Some barbarians have primals paths that represent a deliberate mastery of rage, where some subclasses instead have been influenced by magical powers.
            
            Your Primal Path gives you extra features at this level and at levels 6, 10, and 14.
            
            Primal Paths published elsewhere are compatible with this version of the barbarian class. For help converting a subclass to function with Elkan 5e, see the Elkan 5e Rules Compendium -> Help.
